Liga Champions: Cerita Bek Man City Jadi Kiper Dadakan
07 Nov 2019, 02:23 by Terjemahan, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Manchester City gagal membawa pulang kemenangan saat bertandang ke markas klub Serie A, Atalanta dalam lanjutan Liga Champions. Juara Liga Inggris ini bermain seri 1-1 dengan tuan rumah, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Manchester City unggul lebih dulu melalui gol Raheem Sterling pada menit ke-7. Atalanta membalas pada babak kedua lewat aksi Mario Pasalic di menit ke-49.
Ada peristiwa menarik jelang laga berakhir. Manchester City harus bermain dengan 10 orang saat kiper Claudio Bravo menjadi kartu merah dari wasit di menit ke-81. Manajer Pep Guardiola terpaksa harus menurunkan Kyle Walker yang sebenarnya berposisi sebagai bek.
Bravo merupakan kiper kedua City. Di laga itu ia masuk menggantikan Ederson yang ditarik keluar lapangan pada babak pertama karena cedera. Walker pun sukses menjaga gawang City hingga laga usai.
Selepas pertandingan, Walker mengatakan, hasil imbang dari Atalanta patut disyukuri. Sebab, menurut dia, sejak awal tim sudah memprediksi laga bakal berjalan tidak mudah. "Kami datang ke sini untuk meraih poin atau kemenangan. Laga berjalan ketat karena mereka mengawal kami satu-satu," sebut dia.
Menanggapi perannya sebagai kiper di laga tersebut Walker merasa seperti "relawan". Dalam sesi latihan Walker mengaku pernah mencoba menjadi kiper dan kerap bersenda gurau dengan penjaga gawang City.
Di klasemen Grup C Liga Champions, Manchester City berada di peringkat pertama dengan 10 poin. Sedangkan Atalanta mengisi posisi juru kunci dengan satu poin.

Champions League: Story of Man City Defender Becomes Immediate Goalkeeper
Nov 7 2019, 02:23 by translations, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Manchester City failed to bring home a victory when they travel to the headquarters of the Serie A club, Atalanta in the Champions League continued. The English league champions play 1-1 with the hosts on Thursday 7 November 2019.
Manchester City took the lead through Raheem Sterling's goal in the 7th minute. Atalanta responded in the second half through Mario Pasalic in the 49th minute.
There are interesting events ahead of the game ended. Manchester City had to play with 10 men when goalkeeper Claudio Bravo was red carded by the referee in the 81st minute. Manager Pep Guardiola was forced to lose Kyle Walker who actually plays as a defender.
Bravo is City's second goalkeeper. In that match he came on for Ederson, who was pulled off the field in the first round because of an injury. Walker also successfully guarded City's goal until the fight was over.
After the match, Walker said, a draw from Atalanta was to be thankful for. Because, according to him, from the beginning the team had predicted the game would not be easy. "We came here to get points or victory. The game was tight because they were guarding us one by one," he said.
Responding to his role as goalkeeper in the game Walker felt like a "volunteer". In a training session Walker claimed to have tried to be a goalkeeper and often joked with City goalkeeper.
In the Champions League Group C standings, Manchester City is ranked first with 10 points. While Atalanta filled the position of caretaker with one point.
